c74object.name: bach.prepend
c74object.digest: Add an llll in front of input
c74object.description: Adds a given llll in front of the input llll.

objarg.name: llll_to_be_prepended
objarg.description: The optional argument is the initial llll to be prepended (default: null).

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs the operation on the most received input data.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is the original llll, to which the llll coming from the second inlet (or set as argument) is prepended, and the result is output.
An llll in the second inlet is the llll to be prepended.

attribute.name: inwrap
attribute.description: Wrap every incoming llll in the corresponding number of parentheses. This is equivalent to connecting a bach.wrap object to every llll inlet.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: outwrap
attribute.description: Wrap every output llll in the correspongind number of parentheses. This is equivalent to connecting a bach.wrap object to every llll outlet.

c74object.discussion: The abstraction is a simple wrapper of bach.append.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The abstraction is a simple wrapper of bach.append.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: prepend, combine, concatenate, add, front, append.
